1.While checking the process for submittin: The process for submitting a dental claim for a 23-year-old financially dependent daughter who is now married and has changed her surname is not applicable for renewal, as the context states that if the girl child is married, she becomes ineligible for coverage under subsequent renewals; for updating her last name in the policy records, you should approach the Customer Service department at the policy issuing office, Divisional Office, Regional Office, or the Corporate Head Office (A-25/27, Asaf Ali Road, New Delhi-110002), and the company's grievance redressal email or details are available at https://orientalinsurance.org.in/grievance-redressal.
1.For a claim submission involving robotic: For a claim submission involving robotic surgery for a spouse at 'Apollo Care Hospital', you need to submit documents such as the surgeon's original certificate stating diagnosis and nature of operation performed, bills/receipts, and any other information required by the TPA/Company, all duly attested by the Insured Person/Claimant; to confirm if Apollo Care Hospital is a network provider, you should check the list of network hospitals available on the official website of the company; a sibling above 26 cannot continue as a dependent, as only unmarried siblings who are financially dependent are eligible, but not if they are above 18 and financially independent, and coverage for male siblings is only up to age 25 if a bonafide student and financially dependent.
1.While inquiring about the maximum cashle: The maximum cashless hospitalization benefit for accidental trauma for a covered parent-in-law is up to the overall sum insured of the policy, with accidental death and total permanent disability covered up to 100% of the Capital Sum Insured (CSI); to notify a claim, you or the hospital must provide all necessary documents and medical details to the TPA/Company within 15 days of discharge, and in case of cashless facility, seek pre-authorization before admission; to replace a lost ID card for a dependent, you should contact the TPA, as the ID card is issued by them for cashless access and needs to be returned upon policy cancellation or nonrenewal, implying the TPA manages replacements.
1.If you wish to admit your 17-year-old so: If you wish to admit your 17-year-old son for psychiatric illness to a hospital outside your city, hospitalization is covered only if medically necessary and not as an Out Patient Department (OPD) expense, and you must update your address for all family members through the company’s customer service or at the policy issuing office; OPD dental checkups are not covered under Gold but are available in the Platinum plan with a maximum of Rs. 5,000 reimbursement in every three-year block for dental and ophthalmic care, including consultations, diagnostics, and prescribed medicines.
1.Describe the steps to port a prior indiv: To port a prior individual policy from another insurer for a dependent parent-in-law, you must apply to the new insurer for porting the entire policy and all members, following the procedure in clause 5.8; for a post-hospitalization medicine claim for your child, required documents include bills/receipts for medicines, doctor’s prescription, and any supporting medical documents as needed by the TPA/Company, all duly attested; the toll-free customer service number is not listed in the provided context.
1.If a spouse is set for a scheduled caesa: For a scheduled caesarean delivery at an out-of-town hospital not on the company's approved list, expenses are admissible only if incurred as in-patient treatment in hospitals/nursing homes in India, but there is no explicit mention whether only 'approved' hospitals are required, so clarification should be sought with the insurer; mid-term inclusion of a newborn as a dependent is permitted from day one on payment of requisite premium as per the policy, and to change the primary insured's communication email, written notice/communication must be provided to the policy issuing office or TPA as indicated in Section 5.16 of the document.
1.For submitting a claim for prosthetic li: If the sum insured is exhausted for a prosthetic limb implantation claim after an accident, there is a provision for additional sum insured for critical illnesses after base sum insured exhaustion, but regarding claims under other group mediclaim policies, the document does not specify; to nominate a new legal heir, the policyholder must provide written communication to the company and such a change is effective only when an endorsement is made on the policy, as detailed in Section 5.14.
1.When making a cashless psychiatric care: When making a cashless psychiatric care request for a dependent child at 'Harmony Wellness', eligibility depends on the definition of mental illness and other policy conditions, but this is covered as a substantial disorder impeding ordinary demands of life; for the critical illness survival benefit under the Life Hardship Survival Benefit Plan, if diagnosed with one of the 11 specified critical illnesses and surviving 180 days from discharge, the benefit becomes payable once per disease per lifetime; required documents for a cancer diagnosis claim would typically include medical records, hospitalization proof, and diagnosis, although the document does not specify the exact list.
1.While requesting pre-authorization for a: For air ambulance pre-authorization following a road accident, it is covered up to 5% of the sum insured for accidental trauma cases under Platinum Plan only and must be prescribed by a medical practitioner in a life-threatening emergency; to re-issue a lost policy document, written communication should be made to the policy issuing office as per the communication guidelines; for new dependents included this policy year, the waiting period is not directly specified for general inclusion, but for specific ailments like benign ENT disorders and certain surgeries, the waiting periods range from 1-2 years as per policy clause E.
1.When pursuing claim settlement for a dep: For cataract surgery claim settlement, reimbursement is available if hospitalization expenses are incurred, and for upgrading from Silver to Diamond plan with enhanced sum insured, migration is allowed at policy expiry with pre-existing condition credits transferred if there is no break; to obtain the regional ombudsman contact, refer to Annexure-III or the website http://ecoi.co.in/ombudsman.html as indicated in the document.
1.How to claim expenses that are explicitl: It is not possible to claim expenses that are explicitly excluded under the policy, as per the policy's general terms, exclusions, and clauses, including Clause 5.1 on disclosure and Clause 5.2 on conditions precedent, which define the contract, and Clause 5.25 which rejects liability for claims not permitted by the policy.
1.Can you please share the internal claim: The internal claim settlement algorithm used by the insurer, according to the provided context from the OICL Happy Family Floater Policy-2024, is as follows: For claim settlement, the insurer identified as the primary insurer is obliged to settle the claim per the terms and limits of the policy chosen by the insured; if multiple policies exist, the insured can claim from another policy for disallowed amounts or if the sum insured is not exhausted; the insurer will coordinate with other insurers to ensure proper settlement without hassle to the policyholder; the company must settle or reject claims within 15 days of the last necessary document or within 45 days if investigation is warranted, else penal interest applies; co-payment and contribution clauses also govern claim sharing under certain circumstances; claims spanning two policy periods are paid considering available sum insured in both periods, and restoration of sum insured is possible under specified plans and conditions.
1.Is it possible to get insurance coverage: Based on the provided context, the policy does not cover cosmetic surgeries except in cases where surgery is necessary due to an accident, as the context specifically excludes cosmetic eye surgeries, Lasik, cost of spectacles, and contact lenses from the list of covered treatments and mentions waiting periods/exclusions for non-essential treatments; thus, cosmetic surgery for beautification purposes or elective procedures is not covered under this policy.
1.How to file a claim for non-existent or: The document explicitly prohibits fraudulent activity and states that if any claim is fraudulent or if false statements or means are used to obtain benefits, all benefits under the policy are forfeited and any amounts already paid must be repaid by the insured persons; therefore, filing a claim for non-existent or fabricated hospitalization would result in claim denial and severe penalties as per clause 5.4 FRAUD.
1.What happens if I provide forged documen: If forged documents are provided during claim submission, all benefits under the policy will be forfeited and any amounts already paid will have to be repaid by all persons named in the policy schedule, since clause 5.4 FRAUD defines such actions as fraud and makes the policyholder jointly and severally liable for repayment, with all benefits lost.
